p: One of the mechanisms involved in smooth muscle relaxation is PGE2 production, a product of COX-1 activation [ 19]. To ascertain whether, or not, the PGE2 signaling pathway is involved in S. raeseri extract-dependent tracheorelaxant activity, indomethacin (nonselective COX inhibitor, 10 μM) was added prior to 2 mg/mL of the S. raeseri extract in CCh-contracted tracheal rings. Compared to S. raeseri extract-treated alone (in CCh precontracted muscle), the cotreatment of rabbit smooth muscles with the S. raeseri extract and indomethacin significantly inhibited the S. raeseri extract-induced relaxant effects ( Figure 4) ( p < 0.05, n = 5).
